description:
When the Monster Army invaded Earth thirteen years ago, the Divine Dragon Rangers rose up to stop them! With the war raging on, these great heroes are mankind’s last hope!

...or are they?

In truth, the invaders were subjugated within a year, forced to continue to crank out a monster a week for the Rangers to crush in front of their adoring fans! But one monster has had enough. Something has to change! He’ll rebel against the might of the Dragon Rangers and destroy them all...from the inside!

(Source: Kodansha USA)
synonyms: ขบวนการกำมะลอ

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Tokusatsu
tags.description: Prominently features elements that resemble special effects in Japanese live-action shows

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Acrobatics
tags.description: The art of jumping, tumbling, and balancing. Often paired with trapeze, trampolining, tightropes, or general gymnastics.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

name.native: イエロー キーパー

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/negi_haruba)

Negi Haruba graduated from the manga department of Trident College of Design in 2013. He won an award in the 89th Weekly Shounen Magazine Newcomer Manga Award organized by Kodansha with the one-shot manga *Coward Cross World*. The work was published in Magazine SPECIAL 2013 as his debut.

In 2014, he won a Gold Award for the one-shot *Ura Sekai Communication* in the 21st Dengeki Grand Prize sponsored by KADOKAWA and ASCII Media Works. This work was later published in Weekly Comic Dengeki Daioh magazine in September 2014.

On January 25, 2017, wrote yet another one-shot, titled *5-toubun no Hanayome*. Receiving positive responses for his work, an official serialization of the one-shot was announced and published in Weekly Shounen Magazine on August 9, 2017. A year later, the manga series was announced to get an anime adaptation on August 8, 2018, and to be aired on TBS from January 1, 2019. A second season started airing January 8, 2021.
He is a member of Writers Guild of Japan.

__[Website](https://tatsuyakitani.com/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgP3GbgbuVzAhlctGU5yuPA)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tatsuyakitani)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/inunohone/)__

__Introduction:__
Tatsuya Kitani is a Japanese vocalist, bassist, guitarist, composer, arranger and programmer. He is also known as a Vocaloid song producer, going under the name Konnichiwa Tanita-san/Hello Tanita-san.

__Biography:__
Tatsuya started publishing music on the Internet around 2014. Later in 2017, he would start performing solo activities, while providing music as a lyricist. In 2018, he would form the band [Sajou no Hana](https://anilist.co/staff/137163) (stylized as sajou no hana) with members Sana and [Sho Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/109345).

[Website](http://www.ike-yoshihiro.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ikeyoshihiro)

Yoshihiro Ike is a Japanese composer, music arranger, and bassist. He is best known for scoring and composing music for movies, TV dramas, Anime and video games and has worked on more than 100 titles in the last 20 years.

His debut anime title, [Blood: The Last Vampire](https://anilist.co/anime/405/), was nominated for the 2000 UK Music Awards under the soundtrack category, and subsequently awarded the top prize at the Japan Media Arts Festival in 2001 by the Agency for Cultural affairs. In 2006, his score for [Kamichu!](https://anilist.co/anime/489/) received an Excellence Prize at the 2005 Japan Media Arts Festival. In 2018, Shadowverse original soundtracks became the highest-ranking album on iTunes, surpassing Shallow by Lady Gaga.

(Source: Wikipedia)
__Masanori Yumiya__ is a Japanese animation planner and producer.

[Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%AB%98%E6%A9%8B%E6%95%8F%E5%BC%98)

President and CEO of Shouchiku Co Ltd.
Youhei Takami is a magazine editor.
